docs.text: violence is bad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: violence is ugly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: violence breeds yet more violence .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kids , don't try this at home .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this weighty message isn't the only barrier to enjoying brother , but it's certainly one of the largest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: written , directed by , and starring the infamous takeshi kitano ( kikujiro , sonatine ) brother is his first film made outside his familial japan , bringing the yakuza tradition to los angeles .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( yakuza translated for the average american is the japanese mafia . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if you piss a " family " member off , or dishonor yourself in any way , the usual punishment is public display of self-mutilation , usually resulting in the loss of limbs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a definition of dishonor can be anything from making a stupid decision to leaving one family for another .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it would be interesting to know more about where these and other customs come from .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately the film doesn't give too much of an explanation , assuming its audience is aware of kitano's earlier work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are several shots that focus specifically on detailed tattoos that spread across the entire back of the yakuza members , leading one to assume they would be symbolic of something , but you never know what .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then there's a scene in which a man kills himself in front of a rival in exchange for that rival joining the family .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: granted , this is one of the best scenes in the movie , but it doesn't make a lot of sense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead , the two hours are basically spent watching the following : people go out and shoot each other , talk about it for ten-plus minutes , then go out and do it again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the consistently repetitive discussion of territory during these moments involuntarily provokes yawning .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are also plot details thrown in for no identifiable purpose .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all of the sudden yamamoto ( kitano ) has a girlfriend .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he barely speaks to her , treats her like crap , and then sends her away .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: another missed opportunity , considering it is such a big deal for kitano to bring his magic to the united states , is the combination of cultures , which rely too heavily on overused stereotypes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: though slow moving , brother does have good elements .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the action scenes are well directed , clearly defined , and interesting to watch .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some of the violence is more hinted at than shown , which produces the luscious squirm that one goes to see such films for .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actors would be more enticing if they had more to do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: shirase's ( masaya kato ) loud , sarcastic coolness set against yamamoto's quietly threatening attitude is truly an entertaining combination .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: their moments together or apart steal the rest of the show .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: also to its credit , brother tackles the cause and effect of crime with realism .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a life of crime is easy to get sucked into with the first reward of quick cash .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sure people get rich , but they can also lose just as easily .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's a great moral , with a great cast , just not much substance to back it up .
docs.label: negative
